• Something about me:

- Ability to work collaboratively in a team, also able to thrive in a complex and dynamic environment. 
- Entrepreneurial mindset with an ability to take initiative and operate with minimal supervision.
- Also customer oriented, and sound judgemental. 

• Also by getting engaged in several projects in my Bachelor's I have developed passion for innovation, enterprising, commercial, and high-quality manufacturing.

projects.title: Forecasting of PV systems power production using satellite data
projects.description:
• With the increasing impact of climate change, and global warming effect, the use of renewable energy is increasing day by day significantly. 
• Solar energy has proven to be a great renewable energy source in growth of electricity generation.
• Many PV systems have been installed in off-grid and on-grid systems in last few decades.
• It is expected that there will be considerable amount of growth in the upcoming years due to the government policies and the advantages of PV technology. 
• However, due to the variability in irradiance it is not so easy to predict the PV production, and hence the amount and timing of PV power fed into the electricity grid. Oversupply of PV power can lead to congested grids, or even worse, compulsory disconnection of PV systems from the grid leading to a reduction of the share or highly needed renewable energy in the total electricity mix.  Therefore, accurate forecasting of PV production is of shear importance particularly for the electric grid system, such as stability, reliability, planning and operation, and to enable large scale PV power integration.
• This project will include an analysis of satellite data about what and how it should be used appropriately to predict PV performance, subsequently models for forecasting of PV power generation will be selected and combined with irradiance data sources in order to develop a consistent and reliable method for forecasting of PV performance in Netherlands. In the end the method will be validated.

projects.title: Engineering Project Management
projects.description:
• During this course, I had the opportunity to be a quality specialist, a risk specialist, a system engineer, and a maintenance specialist.

• This course helped me improve my communication skills because it was the most important aspect of the project.
• I learned about pull events, milestones, and how to effectively plan them to successfully complete the project, as well as the risk matrix and scrum board.

projects.title: Cost Engineering and Management
projects.description:
• The task was to assess the cost-effectiveness of a power plant that was not necessarily renewable. 
• It was a group project in which everyone had the opportunity to investigate one power plant and then reach a conclusion.
• I researched the coal power plant at the time and calculated the Capex, fixed and variable operations and maintenance costs for the same, as well as the cash flows and then calculated the Net Present Value with it.

projects.title: Maintenance Engineering and management
projects.description:
• We were given an agricultural tractor and had to devise a maintenance strategy for it. 
• During the curriculum, I learned how to derive the Failure, modes, and effects analysis. 
• I also learned about the four types of maintenance strategies: corrective, preventive, risk-based, and condition-based maintenance. 
• With this knowledge, I determined the proper tractor maintenance strategy at the end of the course, which was admired by my supervisor as well.

profile_positions.description:
• I gained extensive knowledge of the rooftop sales process in particular.
For projects less than 1 MW, I used the Helioscope software, and for projects larger than 1 MW or Tender projects, I used PVCase.

• My task was to design panels on the roof using the aforementioned software and to select the appropriate modules and inverters. Also,take into account the shading of other objects as well.

• In this case, I improved my technical knowledge by determining what the setback from the edges should be, the row spacing of the modules, module orientation, and the best version for increased yield. 

• In addition, if the client has any specific comments about the design, I corrected them based on their advice and, if not possible, then provided a solid justification for the same.

• Using the PvSyst software, I calculated the total yield and the performance ratio after creating the designs.
Finally do a P50 - P90 calculation as well.

• I also learned how to create a string and ballast plan.
The string plan is run in Microsoft Excel, and the ballast plan is run in Sunbeam's Gallileo software.
I also learned how to order logistics by calculating cable lengths, cable trays, clamps, mounting structure, and so on.

profile_positions.title: Bar Attendant

profile_positions.description:
• Pursued my graduation thesis on "Forecasting of PV Production using satellite data" at the University of Twente
• The motivation for this thesis is to take action to address the energy crisis by forecasting PV production in order to make efficient use of the resource. 
• The thesis' major goal was to develop a methodology for accurately forecasting PV output. 
• Different types of forecasting methods were investigated. 
• Cloud behavior, the most essential factor for forecasting PV production, was predicted with about 90% accuracy. 
• The accuracy was tested for two separate locations: Mumbai, India, and Enschede, the Netherlands, both of which had different latitude and longitude. 
• The steps were meticulously designed and aimed at achieving the desired results. 
• Weather-related difficulties have indeed been successfully defended. 
• A well-organized work report and presentation 
• To the greatest extent possible, the study's goal of being beneficial to grid stability, system operators for load control and monitoring, scheduling maintenance, and tangentially benefiting local consumers was met.
